sentence.Network_en: Reforms usually begin with extra indexation and more frequent adjustment of controlled interest rates.
sentence.Network_cn: 改革往往始于额外指数化,或者更加频繁地调整控制利率.

sentence.Network_en: Although some wage indexation schemes have been dismantled, the reform of labor markets has been slow.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然某些工资指数化方案已被撤销, 但是劳力市场的改革一直缓慢.

sentence.Network_en: The main snag about indexation lay in the indexation of wages.
sentence.Network_cn: 指数化的主要障碍在于薪资的指数化.

means.word_mean: 1. a system of economic regulation: wages and interest are tied to the cost-of-living index in order to reduce the effects of inflation
